Executable
Class WebOMCLauncher

java.lang.Object
  Executable.WebOMCLauncher

public class WebOMCLauncher
extends java.lang.Object

Main class responsible to try to connect with something on ACS (client or opserver) and put this information on a cache file to leate be displayed by a webservice.

Author:
Andres Villalobos, 2011 Summerjob, Ingenieria de ejecucion en Computacion e Informatica, Universidad Catolica del norte
See Also:
The project Twiki page and my Dailylog please Contact to a.e.v.r.007@gmail.com

          This method check the files, if file exist, will return the complete file path, else will create it
static void createFile(java.lang.String fileName)
          This method create the file on case of this files was not found, like another methods, here i'm executing a bash command line (touch $AXIS2_HOME/WebOMCFiles/cacheFile) to create the file and later be able to write on it.

          This method return the name of the available antennas
private static java.lang.String getDate()
          This method create the date to add to the report
private static java.lang.String[] getDevices()
          This method return the name of the available devices
static java.lang.String getManagerLoc(int AcsInstance, java.lang.String IP)
          This method calculate the manager port using as base the AcsInstance (0 - 9), on base to the information from twiki i found that the AcsPort are defined with this algorithm, so i will use the same to work according to ACS project.
private static java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,Archivo> InitializeAllFiles(java.lang.String[] antennas, java.lang.String[] devices)
          This method create all files to record the information on a hashmap, the key of this hashmap is the name of the file and the value is a Archivo class that you can use to Write and Read information.
private static boolean isAValidBrokerUri(java.lang.String uri)
          This Method validate the broker URI, at this moment, just validate that exist a type of connection, by example "TCP", then an valid ip and then a port, so, if you want to make sure that my client will accept your broker URI, the you must to pass somethink like this : tcp://10.195.17.114:61616 or tcp://localhost:61616
private static boolean isIp(java.lang.String arg2)
          This method validate an IP on IPV4, to do that, i made a split of the parameter, this return an array of String separated by '.', so the first validation is that the array length have exactly 4 blocks, later, we must to validate each number, to do that, we iterate over the array an validate each number, if one of the blocks doesn't have a number, return false, if all number could be validates, then return true.
private static boolean isNumber(java.lang.String arg1)
          This method validate a number, this method is only used to validate ACSIntance an IP numbers, thats why if the number is bigger than 255 and smallest than 0 return false.
static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
          This is the main method that initialize all files and try to connect first to the Manager using an AdvancedComponentClient
private static void PrintUsage()
          Prints the need parameter to run this application and also tell you about $AXIS2_HOME, this enviroment variable must to be seted before to run this application and inside of this directory, must to exist a folder named WebOMCFiles where will be created all the files to use by the webservice.
static java.lang.String recoverPathFile(java.lang.String nameFile)
          This method execute a bash command line (find $AXIS2_HOME/WebOMCFiles/cacheFile -name cacheFile) that retrieve the enviroment variable $AXIS2_HOME adding the name of the file that this program need, cacheFile, but my application can create this file if ths $AXIS2_HOME variable exist on the enviroment.
static void resetFile(java.lang.String fileName)
          This method make the cacheFile on null, on this way, its possible to overwrite the file and always keep actualiced information.

Constructor Detail

WebOMCLauncher

public WebOMCLauncher()
Method Detail

recoverPathFile

public static java.lang.String recoverPathFile(java.lang.String nameFile)
This method execute a bash command line (find $AXIS2_HOME/WebOMCFiles/cacheFile -name cacheFile) that retrieve the enviroment variable $AXIS2_HOME adding the name of the file that this program need, cacheFile, but my application can create this file if ths $AXIS2_HOME variable exist on the enviroment. Its important to have this file on this place because the client read from the same place and the information is on the same place that axis2server keeping on order.

Returns:
The path to the cache file used to record the information (Could be antenna's file or generic's file) using as base the $AXIS2_HOME enviroment variable.

resetFile

public static void resetFile(java.lang.String fileName)
This method make the cacheFile on null, on this way, its possible to overwrite the file and always keep actualiced information. This method execute a bash command line (cat /dev/null > $AXIS2_HOME/WebOMCFiles/cacheFile) that simplily clean the file, or put this file on null. Also this method will wait a 0.1 second to wait that the operation has been executed

createFile

public static void createFile(java.lang.String fileName)
This method create the file on case of this files was not found, like another methods, here i'm executing a bash command line (touch $AXIS2_HOME/WebOMCFiles/cacheFile) to create the file and later be able to write on it.

getManagerLoc

public static java.lang.String getManagerLoc(int AcsInstance,
                                             java.lang.String IP)
This method calculate the manager port using as base the AcsInstance (0 - 9), on base to the information from twiki i found that the AcsPort are defined with this algorithm, so i will use the same to work according to ACS project.

Parameters:
AcsInstance - The Acs instance to use with the client, you can choose between 0 and 9, it AcsInstance is bigger than 9, then this method will use the default AcsInstance (0).
Returns:
The manager location where we can find and connect with the manager that we need to monitor
See Also:
http://almasw.hq.eso.org/almasw/bin/view/ACS/AcsPortsAllocation

PrintUsage

private static void PrintUsage()
Prints the need parameter to run this application and also tell you about $AXIS2_HOME, this enviroment variable must to be seted before to run this application and inside of this directory, must to exist a folder named WebOMCFiles where will be created all the files to use by the webservice.

isNumber

private static boolean isNumber(java.lang.String arg1)
This method validate a number, this method is only used to validate ACSIntance an IP numbers, thats why if the number is bigger than 255 and smallest than 0 return false.

Parameters:
arg1 - the string to ve parse to a int number
Returns:
  • true : If the number is between 0 and 255<\li>
  • false : If the number is bigger than 255 and smallest than 0<\li>

    • isIp

    private static boolean isIp(java.lang.String arg2)
    This method validate an IP on IPV4, to do that, i made a split of the parameter, this return an array of String separated by '.', so the first validation is that the array length have exactly 4 blocks, later, we must to validate each number, to do that, we iterate over the array an validate each number, if one of the blocks doesn't have a number, return false, if all number could be validates, then return true.

    Parameters:
    arg2 - An string passed by parameter that represent the IP
    Returns:
  • true : If is a valid IP
  • false : Is is not a valid IP

    • checkFile

    private static Archivo checkFile(java.lang.String fileName,
                                 boolean write)
    This method check the files, if file exist, will return the complete file path, else will create it

    Parameters:
    fileName - The name of the file to check
    write - Indicate if the file will be to write or read, if write is false, then assume that the file will be used to read
    Returns:
    An Archivo file to write on it.

    InitializeAllFiles

    private static java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,Archivo> InitializeAllFiles(java.lang.String[] antennas,
                                                                              java.lang.String[] devices)
    This method create all files to record the information on a hashmap, the key of this hashmap is the name of the file and the value is a Archivo class that you can use to Write and Read information.

    Returns:
    A HashMap that contain an Archivo to write and read files. The key of the hashmap is the name of the file.

    getAntennaNames

    private static java.lang.String[] getAntennaNames()
    This method return the name of the available antennas

    Returns:
    An array with the name of each antenna

    getDevices

    private static java.lang.String[] getDevices()
    This method return the name of the available devices

    Returns:
    An array with the name of each device

    isAValidBrokerUri

    private static boolean isAValidBrokerUri(java.lang.String uri)
    This Method validate the broker URI, at this moment, just validate that exist a type of connection, by example "TCP", then an valid ip and then a port, so, if you want to make sure that my client will accept your broker URI, the you must to pass somethink like this : tcp://10.195.17.114:61616 or tcp://localhost:61616

    Parameters:
    uri - The address to connect with ActiveMQ server
    Returns:
  • true :

    • main

    public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
                 throws java.lang.Exception
    This is the main method that initialize all files and try to connect first to the Manager using an AdvancedComponentClient

    Parameters:
    args - {[1]=ACSInstance , [2]=ManagerIP , [3]= Time to refresh the information} or {[1]=-h to see some help}
    Throws:
    java.lang.Exception

    getDate

    private static java.lang.String getDate()
    This method create the date to add to the report

    Returns:
    A string with the actual date on the following format "yyyy'/'MM'/'dd 'at' hh:mm:ss z", example = 2011/02/04 at 09:35:39 UTC
